name: W Atlanta - Buckhead

reviews.text: Not worth the money. Staff was rude when informed of poor condition of the room,Not child friendly, walls are dirty and overall i was not impressed i checked out the next day and payed $1,800 to stay at a diffrent hotel insteadfor the next 2weeks...
reviews.title: Nothing special

reviews.text: I have had other bad experiences here, but since I am a Starwood junkie and I love the Buckhead neighborhood, I gave this property one more chance. Never again.
reviews.title: Not a W...barely a Motel 6.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Its not remotely up to W/Starwood standards. It used to be a low end hotel and they tried unsuccesfully to retrofit it and make it into a W. They failed. Small cramped rooms. And that was with my Platinum "upgrade".
reviews.title: 'W' does not stand for 'Wonderful' !

reviews.text: The noise factor is significant. Even without a big party on the roof it is a very loud, poorly insulated hotel. The elevators smelled of...sorry...vomit. I assume from the night before. Wallpaper had been torn from the hallway walls.
reviews.title: GREAT SERVICE

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed November 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I feel like I am in a dorm everytime I stay here. I am not 20...so I will not make the mistake again. This place should be taken out of the Starwood brand...and given over to Georgia Tech student housing.
reviews.title: Great location. 2 min. walk to Lenox Square

reviews.text: If you want great service prior to arrival-at your arrival-during your stay-during check out- and after your stay....The W Hotel at Buckhead is the place to stay!! I stayed there for NYE and they handled every one of my requests like a VIP client. The sheer volume of people for that night was amazing and they STILL made time to handle a printer issue request.
reviews.title: BEST SERVICE EVER!!!

reviews.text: If you stay I hope you encounter the following individuals who made my stay Wonderful! Concierge;Michael Searcy-Front:LaWanna-Front: Felicia Emanuel-Bar: Tim-Mgr: Brad- Mgr:Hong Le-Insider:Scott Ragland......Thank you Doyle G. Confirmation#: 755211761
reviews.title: Nice property, not perfect for kids

reviews.text: I should preface this review by acknowledging that we only stayed at the W for one night on the way to Florida. We got the place for a very reasonable rate through Priceline.
reviews.title: Rude front desk employees

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Given what we paid, this was a very nice hotel. The rooms were well equiped and nicely decorated. Beds were nice and we had enough room for all four of us (two adults and two kids).
reviews.title: wonderful stay

reviews.text: The property is located in the Buckhead area of Atlanta and the hotel's facilities reflect it. The place includes a night club, high end restaurant and health club. The W is known for trendy design and this one does not disappoint.
reviews.title: Business Trip in Dec 2011

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Service was great and Whiskey Blue was the best ever! I highly recommend. Celebrated my 1st Anniversary and we had complimentary champagne and berries. However, the room was smaller than expected and the bathroom area was just tiny and cramped. The lighting was terrible so I had much difficulty getting my make-up on and styling my hair. The heating unit was so noisy that I eventually turned it all the way down. But very good location, walking distance to malls and restaurants.Scott at the front desk is absolutely the friendliest person and is extremely accommodating.
reviews.title: Great service but rooms need improvement

reviews.text: I have to travel to Atlanta for business often and I try to stay at the W in Buckhead. The staff is very friendly and responsive, the rooms are a great mix of style (very cool interiors) and business (they all seem to have a desk or two in them) and it's just all-in-all easy which is great when you're traveling for business. The location is convenient as well.
reviews.title: Great Stays

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My two issues are that I wish they had high-speed internet for free and I did have to push to get down pillows sent up (first time wasn't down, second call was down).
reviews.title: Wonderful Experience

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I will continue to return to this hotel.
reviews.title: Bar was awkwardly dark

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed December 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Just to get away from the house during the holidays, my partner and I decided to stay at this W for a night. We found the staff to be extremely gracious and helpful. The room had a great view and bed was very comfortable. I did not feel like we were lacking anything at all. We chose to eat out for dinner, but had breakfast at the hotel the next morning. Our server was really attentive and the food was spectacular.....try the pancakes! No doubt that we would stay here again.
reviews.title: Not a hotel for children or family

reviews.text: Nice Hotel in Buckhead but not the W I expected... I agree with other writers... the housekeepers are loud with their knocking and the doors at the hotel seem to slam all the time. The bathroom in the room has very little privacy since the door is not sound proof(it like a very thin sliding door)... The actual bathroom is very small... so if you are tall good luck. I found the room to be pretty but for some strange reason I felt like I was staying in an office not a hotel room. I do find this to be a kind of weird W Hotel... I can not place my finger on it but it does not have the same vibe of other W Hotels I have stayed at. The heater is VERY loud but they have some sort of noise machine that I guess is suppose to be used so that you don't hear the heater... does not sound VERY W to me! But then again this is the most inexpensive W I have stayed at so maybe I should not be comparing it to other W Hotels?! Parking is overpriced like all hotels in Buckhead.
reviews.title: Nice Hotel in Buckhead but not the W I expected

reviews.text: The room is somewhere between a nice Hyatt and a bad W. This is definitely not a NY, LA or SF W. All you hear all morning is the sound of that metal against wood knocking on ever door in the hall with the accompanying shout of "housekeeping" plus the sound of non-stop door slamming. The kind of door slamming that makes you think you're at a Marriott. The heater is circa Holiday Inn 1982. It was so loud I had to put a jacket on and shut it off to have a conf call. There used to be cool mix compilation CD's in the rooms...now there was something worn and dated which plays through the bad TV speakers. Took 20 minutes to get hot water for a shower mid day because, as they explained "not enough people were using hot water at mid day." Just a reminder that you're not really in a boutique hotel, you're at a factory. I could go on but suffice to day, if this W is a harbinger, the W Brand is definitely on the downward slide.
reviews.title: Is this really a W or just a fancy Hyatt?

reviews.text: I've stayed at this hotel three times on business trips. Each time, I forgot that the club on the top floor sends booming bass that rattles the walls down a few floors. I'm always shocked that they think this wouldn't impact guests trying to sleep in the hotel. In fact, the last time I was there, I stood behind three people in line to check out -- every one of them commented on how they couldn't sleep because of the music from the club.
reviews.title: Low floor for Sleep - but Great service

reviews.text: Having said that, the service is great at this hotel, the rooms are nice, the location is great, and the food and service at the restaurant is great. (breakfast is the meal I've experienced).
reviews.title: Mixed impression

reviews.text: So I recommend this hotel -- just request a low floor so that you're as far away as possible from the club.
reviews.title: Sweetttt!

description: The W Atlanta Buckhead combines modern luxury and Southern charm into its chic design and welcoming atmosphere, in a neighborhood with upscale living, specialty shopping, and the hottest nightlife.
